abstract: Large population of Caucasian mollusc Harmozica ravergiensis was found in the Gvozdiv village in Kyiv region. There were no reports of this species from Central Ukraine before and this locality is most northwestern for it. Population was monitored during 2015-2017 and evidently survived two winters on the open grounds in this period. Shell and reproductive anatomy of H. ravergiensis from Gvozdiv are described and illustrated. The presence of the species in area is discussed. Moreover, another new finding of H. ravergiensis is reported: in Petrykivka village (Dnipropetrovsk region, Southern Ukraine) in 2016.
